author: dmitriishmatko
content: <@!194432762315407360> btw, why do we need to increase packet size on 16 bytes for iv as a main purpose is blinding? We could use constant iv or 4 bytes iv (in packet) + 00x12 (in function input)

author: .fjl
content: If the IV for AES-CTR is re-used for multiple plaintexts on the same key, it becomes trivial to extract the key.

author: .fjl
content: I guess we could do it, since the key is not important at all (it's just the node id)

author: .fjl
content: but didn't feel like the proper way of doing things

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
ah, yeah, ok, const could be inspected and be in the firmware of router
but 4 bytes + const looks good

author: dmitriishmatko
content: looks a bit strange, agree, but we could save world with those 12 bytes x billions of packets ðŸ˜†

author: .fjl
content: yeah, I understand what you mean

author: .fjl
content: sometimes best not to worry about this. we could save the world in the same way by not creating this protocol at all.
